weka.clusterers

Class DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.clusterers.DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder>
    Enclosing class:
    DBACluster.AntHill

    protected class DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder>
    Placeholder for a Instance object.

    InstancePlaceholder objects are agents for weka.core.Instance objects, that provide functionality required by the classes of this clusterer. An InstancePlaceholder object represents exactly one Instance, so the association is unambiguous.

      • foi

        protected double foi
        Local similarity value for this InstancePlaceholder object.

        The calculated local similarity is also stored in this object, although ants do the calculation. It is stored here, to avoid several calculations of the same value. The result is independent from the ant doing the calculation. So if another ant goes to this InstancePlaceholder, it can access the calculation result done by another ant. The algorithm logic does not change if each ant has to do its own calculation.

      • foiIsCalculated

        protected boolean foiIsCalculated
        Indicates if the local similarity was already calculated for this InstancePlaceholder.

      • hasNoiseCluster

        public boolean hasNoiseCluster()
        Tells if this InstancePlaceholder is clustered in the noise cluster, that means it was recognized as noise.
        Returns:
        true, if this InstancePlaceholder in the noise cluster, false if it is not. The value is also false, if it is not clustered.

      • deleteCluster

        public void deleteCluster()
        Deletes the cluster association for this InstancePlaceholder and make it unclustered.

      • preTellNeighbor

        public void preTellNeighbor(DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholderNeighborTag neighbor)
        Notifies this InstancePlaceholder about a neighbor it has.

        This InstancePlaceholder can also be notified about a neighbor, even it does not search for neighbors at the moment. Usually it gets informed about some neighbors before it searches for neighbors itself. When it already did this search, it is assumed that it found all neighbors it has, so this method does not provide any new information. As symmetric neighborhood relations are assumed not every InstancePlaceholder must run through all other InstancePlaceholder objects (decended from Instance objects in Instances). For more information the annotations for DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholders.getUnexploredNeighborhoodList().

        Parameters:
        neighbor - a neighborhood relation found for this InstancePlaceholder.
        See Also:
        DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholders.getUnexploredNeighborhoodList()

      • setNeighbors

        public void setNeighbors(java.util.ArrayList<DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholderNeighborTag> neighbors)
        Notifies this InstancePlaceholder about all its neighbors. The final neighborhood list, containing all neighbors must be provided. Then it is assumed that all neighbors are known.
        Parameters:
        neighbors - complete list of all neighborhood relations.

      • getNeighbors

        public java.util.ArrayList<DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholderNeighborTag> getNeighbors()
        Tells all currently known neighborhood relations of this InstancePlaceholder.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all currently known neighborhood relations.
